topic.title: SMBus Command

body.p: The SMBus Command is used to operate the SMBus master to access SMBus slave, these commands are compatible with the SMBus 2.0 spec.

row.entry: TWI master transaction timeout and bus recovery success
TWI master transaction timeout and bus recovery fail
Failed recovery after slave address set failure
Master activity during slave address set attempt

entry.p: SMBus Quick Command not supported by hardware
The port is not configured to be SMBus
Received PEC doesn't match expected value

body.p: This field provides the following configuration options for the SMBus master.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction need the PEC byte for checksum.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Quick Command with Write Sub-Command

body.p: The Quick command with Write sub-command is used to send write operation to SMBus slave.

section.title: Quick Command With Write Sub-Command Input Data
section.p: The Quick command with Write sub-command is used to send write operation to SMBus slave.

table.title: Quick Command With Write Sub-Command Input Data
Quick Command With Write Sub-Command Input Data

section.p: This field should be 0 to perform a Quick command with Write.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below. .
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.

topic.title: Quick Command With Read Sub-Command

body.p: The Quick command with Read Sub-Command is used to send read operation to SMBus slave.

section.title: Quick Command With Read Sub-Command Input Data

table.title: Quick Command With Read Command Input Data
Quick Command With Read Command Input Data

section.p: This field should be 1 to perform a quick command with read.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Send Byte Command

body.p: The Send Byte Sub-Command is used to send one byte data to SMBus slave.

section.title: Send Byte Command Input Data
section.p: This field should be 2 to perform send byte command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the one byte data send to slave.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Receive Byte Command

body.p: The Receive Byte Sub-Command is used to receive one byte data from SMBus slave.

section.title: Receive Byte Command Input Data
section.p: This field should be 3 to perform a Receive Byte command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field should be 3 to perform a receive byte command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides one byte data received from SMBus slave.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Write Byte Sub-Command

body.p: The Write Byte sub-command is used to send command code with one byte data to SMBus slave.

section.title: Write Byte Sub-Command Input Data
section.p: This field should be 4 to perform a Write Byte command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code, that the slave should recognize.
This field provides the data length, here it's 1 byte for write byte command.
This field provides the one byte data send to slave.

topic.title: Read Byte Command

section.title: Read Byte Command Input Data
section.p: The Read Byte Sub-command is used to send command code to SMBus slave and receive one byte data from SMBus slave.
This field should be 5 to perform a read byte command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code that the slave should recognize.
This field should be 5 to perform a read byte command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction need the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code, that the slave should recognize.
This field provides one byte data received from SMBus slave.

topic.title: Write Word Sub-Command

body.p: The Write Word Sub-command is used to send command code to SMBus slave and send two bytes data to SMBus slave.

section.title: Write Word Sub-Command Input Data
section.p: This field should be 6 to perform a write word command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below. .
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code, that the slave should recognize.
This field provides two bytes data send to SMBus slave.

topic.title: Read Word Command

body.p: The Read Word Sub-Command is used to send command code to SMBus slave and receive two bytes data from SMBus slave.

section.title: Read Word Sub-Command Input Data
section.p: This field should be 7 to perform a Read Word command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code that the slave should recognize.
This field should be 7 to perform a Read Word command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction need the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code, that the slave should recognize.
This field provides two bytes data received from SMBus slave.

topic.title: Block Write Sub-Command

body.p: The Block Write Sub-command is used to send command code to SMBus slave and send maximum of 32 bytes data to SMBus slave.

section.title: Block Write Sub-Command Input Data
section.p: This field should be 8 to perform a Block Write command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code, that the slave should recognize.
This field provides maximum of 32 bytes data send to SMBus slave.

topic.title: Block Read Sub-Command

section.title: Block Read Sub-Command Input Data
section.p: The Block Read Sub-command is used to send command code to SMBus slave and receive maximum of 32 bytes data from SMBus slave.
This field should be 9 to perform a block read command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction need the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the Command Code, that the slave should recognize.
This field should be 7 to perform a Block Read command.
This field provides the SMBus master port index, which is connected to the slave with Slave Address set as below.
This field provides the SMBus slave 7-bit address, without right shift.
This field provides the PEC flag, which indicates if the transaction needs the PEC byte for checksum.
This field provides the command code, that the slave should recognize.
This field provides maximum of 32 bytes data received from SMBus slave.
